action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Andy Crebar

full_threads.body:
Hey @andy

just a heads-up that Matt reached out sounding a bit confused and concerned about us moving his site to another server.

He’s unsure why it was necessary.

We feel like it would really help if the explanation came from you directly — he’s quite cautious, and hearing it from you would go a long way in easing any concerns.

Here’s a quick summary of the main points you could touch on:
  • The move is part of our standard Care Plan setup.
  • It allows us to properly manage updates, plugins, and improvements going forward.
  • We also need the right access to implement and maintain proper security.
  • This setup ensures long-term stability and makes it easier for us to support the site proactively.
  • If something breaks, it would be easier for us to fix quickly and with less risk.

Let me know if you want me to jump in with anything else or if you'd like us to call Matt instead

Next Step:
  • Andy to contact Matt, reassuring him 🙏

Hi team,

I'm a bit confused and concerned when you say you've copied and moved my site over to another server. I do not know what this means exactly. Why do you need to move servers?

Can someone please call me tomorrow to talk about this?

Thanks
Matt
Matthew Board

Managing Director

Broker.com.au

matt.board@broker.com.au

+61 416 972 634
Thank you @andy for the heads up 🙏

Hi Matthew,

I hope you’re having a great day!

Just a quick update from our side:
  • 2FA setup: We weren’t able to set up MiniOrange 2FA as the field doesn’t appear in our profile. Just as a heads-up, we usually use Wordfence Login Security across most of our sites—it’s been really reliable for us, if you’re open to that option.

  • Site migration: Thanks again for upgrading our access! We’ve now copied the site over to our server—here’s the link if you’d like to take a look: https://broker.wolfiq.cloud.

As part of the plan, we’ll then proceed with working on the site fixes. We’ll keep you posted as we make those updates.

Let me know if there’s anything else you need—we’re always happy to help!

Hey @allieB - Just a quick heads up as part of his onboarding we promised to fix up some issues on his site. I'll send that through in a separate support ticket now (should be under custom dev ).

When communicating, just make sure we make that clear (i.e. we're working on the fixes next)

Hi Matt,

Jumping in here - it looks like we’ve been added as a blog editor rather than as an site admin.

To give us the right access to support your site, could you please follow these steps:
  1. Log in to your WordPress dashboard.
  2. Navigate to Users > Add New.
  3. Enter our email address: support@wolfiq.com.au
  4. Set the Role to “Administrator”.
  5. Click Add New User.

Let me know if stuck and I can give you a quick call!

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Andy Crebar

full_threads.body:
Hi @andy ,

Just a quick heads-up—I think it might be best if this next step comes from you. The client seems a bit cautious about where their site access details are going, and hearing from you directly could help ease any concerns.

Here’s a quick overview of how we typically handle onboarding:
  • We log into the client’s website using admin credentials, or they create an admin account for us.
  • Once logged in, we install a plugin called Migrate Guru to copy the site over to our server on Kinsta.

For more complex sites—especially those with tighter plugin restrictions—we’ll usually take a different route:
  • In those cases, we request cPanel access and handle the migration manually instead of using Migrate Guru.

Hope that helps clarify things! Let me know if you’d like me to draft anything for you to send or if you need more info.

Happy to help.

CC: @joel @daphne

Hi Matt,

I hope you’re doing well.

Thanks for sending the details across — we were just about to reach out.

We managed to log in using the backup codes. However, upon accessing the site, it looks like there’s an issue with the SMTP configuration, and we’re unable to complete the email verification step.

When you get a chance, could you please:
  • Add support@wolfiq.com.au to your WordPress
  • Send through the username and password for access
  • If possible (optional), provide cPanel access (this would be even better)

Apologies for the extra step—this can sometimes come up depending on how the site’s initially set up.

Appreciate your assistance!
